H0.text: Lateral continuity is the geological principle exemplified by the same rock layers being visible on opposite sides of the Grand Canyon and having been deposited simultaneously.

H1.text: Width continuity is the geological concept illustrated by the fact that the same rock layers are visible on opposite sides of the Grand Canyon and were deposited simultaneously.

H2.text: Bilateral continuity is the example of the same rock layers being visible on opposite sides of the Grand Canyon, indicating they were deposited simultaneously.

H3.text: Directly continuity is the example of the same rock layers visible on opposite sides of the Grand Canyon that were deposited simultaneously.
